qas.question: When is the end of the dolphin migration period in St. Barts?
When is the beggining of the whale migration season?
What protected species is a common sight along the beaches of St. Barts?
What is the favorite prey of leatherback sea turtles?
How long does it take dolphins to attain reproductive age?
How long does it take whales to reach reproductive age?
How long do porpoises usually live?
How many species of turtles are there on St. Barts?
What does a whales diet consist of?

context: Marine mammals are many, such as the dolphins, porpoises and whales, which are seen here during the migration period from <a1_0>December<a1_0/> till <a0_0>May<a0_0/>. <a2_0>Turtles<a2_0/> are a common sight along the coastline of the island. They are a protected species and in the endangered list. It is stated that it will take <b5_0><b6_0>15–<b7_0>50 years<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> for this species to attain reproductive age. Though they live in the sea, the females come to the shore to lay eggs and are protected by private societies. <b8_0>Three<b8_0/> species of turtles are particularly notable. These are: The leatherback sea turtles which have leather skin instead of a shell and are the largest of the type found here, some times measuring a much as 3 m (average is about 1.5 m) and weighing about 450 kg (<a3_0>jellyfish<a3_0/> is their favourite diet); the hawksbill turtles, which have hawk-like beaks and found near reefs, generally about 90 cm in diameter and weigh about 60 kg and their diet consists of <b9_0>crabs and snails<b9_0/>; and the green turtles, herbivores which have rounded heads, generally about 90 cm in diameter and live <a4_0>amidst tall sea grasses<a4_0/>.
